result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Hilt, Justin P

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Time of prelim on 11/22 changed by court

9:02 AM Defendant Justin P Hilt in court, in custody.  Attorney Tim Verhoff in court for State of Wisconsin.DE states he has applied for SPD appointment and qualifies, but none has been appointed yet. DE states he wishes to proceed without an attorney with motion for dismissal based on exceeding time limits without an attorney. Atty. Verhoff responds. Court denies motion to dismiss, finds today's date was within time limit. DE states he wishes to maintain both right to attorney and right to proceed with hearing today without waiving time limits, wants counsel appointed today. Court denies request for county appointment today. Court prioritizes right to counsel, finds good cause, sets prelim over to 11-22 at 8:30am.
Preliminary hearing on November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:47 AM Defendant Justin P Hilt in court, in-custody.  Prosecuting attorney Cecilia E DeMarco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn does not have counsel yet. He believes atty Vera will be appt'd to him. Defn does not want to waive time limits and is willing to waive right to atty today. He indicated he wants a speedy trial and doesn't want to delay proceedings. Court setover the prelim to a date within the time limits to allow SPD to be appt'd.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin P Hilt

Prior: 2541 Cross Creek Dr Unit D, Sheboygan, WI 53081 United States

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Cecilia R. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 7

1:58 PM Defendant Justin P Hilt in court, in custody via Zoom.  Attorney Will Rice Anderson in court for Justin P Hilt.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. During bail argument by State, defendant voluntarily absented himself from the hearing. Court proceeded with bail arguments without defendant.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
